body_html:
Looks like it might be a Bazel linking bug. Building the pip package (bazel build --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package) works, and the resulting pip package has contrib/factorization/python/ops/gen_clustering_ops.py. But building this rule explicitly (bazel build //tensorflow/contrib/factorization:gen_gen_clustering_ops_py_wrappers_cc) messes up the dependence of libtensorflow_framework.so on CUDA libraries (the rpaths are wrong).

I'm tempted to just add something like "-Wl,-rpath,/usr/local/cuda/lib64" until this gets fixed...
